posts.topic: Death Penalty: Debates around capital punishment and wrongful convictions
posts.name: DoubtfulJustice
posts.text: Is the death penalty truly just when wrongful convictions still happen so often? I want to believe in accountability, but how can we ignore the systemic errors that risk innocent lives?

posts.topic: Death Penalty: Debates around capital punishment and wrongful convictions
posts.name: JusticeUncertain
posts.text: Is the death penalty truly just when mistakes cannot be undone? Some argue it deters crime, but how do we reconcile that with the risk of executing innocent people, especially when marginalized groups are overrepresented in wrongful conviction stats? Perhaps there are other solutions, though I am not entirely sure...
